item.title: Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade demo for Xbox Series, Switch 2 now available
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Play the game's opening chapter.

Square Enix has released a demo for the Xbox Series and Switch 2 versions of Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade.

For Xbox Series users, the demo is available now via Microsoft Store.

Switch 2 users can enter the following code to download the demo via the “Redeem Code” option in the Nintendo eShop:

  • United States – D3GM3304HKQBB2VB
  • Europe – D3GM3304HKPBB2VB
  • Japan – D3GM3304H3DBB2VB
  • South Korea – D3GM3304H3CBB2VB
  • Hong Kong / Taiwan – D3GM3304H3BBB2VB
  • Southeast Asia – D3GM3304HY9BB2VB

Here is an overview of the demo, via Square Enix:

In the demo, players can experience the game’s iconic opening chapter, in which the mercenary Cloud Strife and the underground resistance group Avalanche attempt to destroy a Mako Reactor powering the dystopian city of Midgar. In their fight against the shadowy Shinra Electric Power Company, Cloud and his comrades are thrust into a larger conflict that will decide the fate of the planet. Players with demo save data on their console can claim the bonus items “Revival Earrings” and “Survival Set” in the full game.

Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade is due out for Xbox Series and Switch 2 on January 22, 2026, and is available now for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store. The PC version will also be available via Microsoft Store starting January 22.
